articles.title: Kim Jong Un Looks Round Guards Units Hall at Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Looks Round Guards Units Hall at Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA), first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and  first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, looked round the Guards Units Hall newly arranged at the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum.
					 When he entered the main lobby that hosts the statue of President Kim Il Sung, he paid tribute to him.
					
					 Noting that it was well done though it was the first color sculpture in the country depicting the President waving back to service personnel of the KPA, he said he felt as if he were seeing the smiling President. 
					
					 He went round the hall of the Guards Units.
					
					 The title of Guards instituted on July 19, 1950 during the war was the highest commendation and honor the President bestowed upon the heroic fighters in the hope of making their distinguished feats go down in the history and letting this glorious tradition of struggle remain shining generation after generation, he said.
					
					 He emphasized the great importance of the Guards Units Hall in conveying to posterity the history of Songun revolutionary activities of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who made sure that the tradition of victory of Guards Units remained shining generation after generation.
					
					 The prevailing situation where a great war for national reunification is at hand requires all the KPA units to become guards units fully prepared for war politically and ideologically, in military technique and materially, he stressed.
					
					 He underlined the need for all the units to conduct a dynamic movement for winning the title of the Guards Unit in order to tear to pieces the Stars and Stripes and the flags of the satellite countries of the U.S. in the war to be fought with it in the future.
					
					 He looked round the halls of the first and second stages of the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 He noted it was important to organize well the visits to the Museum and effectively operate it as it is a center for education in the tradition of victory won by the army and people and a main base for anti-U.S. education.
					
					 He expressed expectation and belief that the officials and lecturers of the Museum would creditably discharge their honorable duty in the future, too.
					
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, Choe Ryong Hae, O Il Jong, Han Kwang Sang, Ri Jae Il, Ri Pyong Chol and Kim Yo Jong.

articles.title: Room Lamp, Gift to Kim Il Sung from Madagascar
articles.content:
Room Lamp, Gift to Kim Il Sung from Madagascar
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- On display at the International Friendship Exhibition House of the DPRK is a room lamp, presented to President Kim Il Sung as a gift by a Madagascan Juche idea study delegation in April Juche 74 (1985) when it visited the DPRK.
					 The delegation prepared this decoration lamp in reflection of the Madagascan people's deep reverence for Kim Il Sung, founder of the Juche idea.
					
					The lamp shows that the great Juche idea lights the road of independence. Depicted on it are Madagascans leading an independent and creative life, guided by the Juche idea.

articles.title: Int'l Matches to Be Played by DPRK Footballers This Year
articles.content:
Int'l Matches to Be Played by DPRK Footballers This Year
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The DPRK will take part in various international football tournaments this year. 
					 Its men's national team is scheduled to attend the Asian regional preliminaries for the 2018 World Cup from June.
					
					 The men's Olympic team will compete with its Thai, Cambodian and Philippine rivals in the preliminaries of the 2016 AFC U-23 Championship in March.
					
					 The DPRK is also to attend the 2015 FIFA U-17 World Cup in October-November and have group league matches with Brazil, Hungary and other countries for the U-20 World Cup in May-June.
					
					 In August, its men's and women's football teams will participate in the 2015 EAFF East Asia Cup. The national women's team came first in the 2013 EAFF East Asia Cup.
					
					 Besides, women footballers of the DPRK are to attend the AFC U-19, U-16 and U-14 championships.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Maehara's Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Maehara's Reckless Remarks
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Maehara, member of the House of Representatives of Japan, at the recent House Budget Committee meeting picked up the issue of the Central Hall of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and charged it with "evasion of law".
					 He blustered that Chongryon should not be allowed to continue to use the Central Hall and the Resolution and Collection Corporation and others should seize its lease fee by exercising all mandates. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday in a commentary terms his outbursts hysteric frenzy of a man steeped in bad blood towards the DPRK and Chongryon to the marrow of his bones.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The issue of advance sale and lease related to the hall of Chongryon is the universally accepted deal made according to procedures recognized by law.
					
					 Japan's legal, political and media circles admit that there has been neither "violation" nor "evasion of law" but everything is being done by law.
					
					 As far as Maehara is concerned, he has earned an ill-fame in the political circle of Japan for his evil practice of following the U.S.
					
					 He, accustomed to pleasing the U.S., took an opportunity of disturbing the process for improving the relations between the DPRK and Japan in a bid to curry favor with his American master and improve his image damaged by his political scandal. 
					
					 Chongryon has conducted its positive activities to defend and ensure democratic and national rights of the Koreans in Japan and the hall has functioned as an inviolable center for activities as Chongryon is playing the role of a diplomatic mission in the absence of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Japan.
					
					 Maehara would be well advised to refrain from his reckless act of hurting his image himself, swimming against the trend of the times.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls upon All Koreans to Respond to Appeal of Nation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls upon All Koreans to Respond to Appeal of Nation 
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The resolution of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the joint slogans of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK reflect the steadfast faith of the WPK and service personnel and people of the DPRK to achieve national reunification, the cherished desire of the nation, as early as possible true to the lifetime wishes of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 They also clarify the revolutionary stand of the WPK and service personnel and people of the DPRK not to allow challenges and moves of the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad blocking the improvement of the inter-Korean relations and the reunification of Korea but mete out a merciless punishment to them. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday says in an article that all Koreans should devote themselves to the patriotic cause of reunification, finding the value and worth of genuine life in the actions for patriotism and independent reunification. 
					
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The prevailing grave situation where the confrontation between the north and the south has reached an extreme phase and peace and security on the Korean peninsula are seriously threatened requires the DPRK to resolutely counter any provocation and war move of the U.S. and south Korean authorities. 
					
					 The call of the above-said resolution and joint slogans represent the call of the present times and the nation and demand of the history. 
					
					 A genuine patriot should respond to the call of the country and the nation, not in words but by practical actions. Every Korean can claim to be a genuine patriot only when he devotes himself to the work for national reunification, taking to heart the division of the country and the nation. 
					
					 Those who seek confrontation with fellow countrymen and war will not be able to escape disgraceful ruin and will be cursed by history and posterity as traitors.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Ridicules U.S. Red Herring
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Ridicules U.S. Red Herring 
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is now busy building up public opinion to divert elsewhere world's focus on its arms buildup and building of missile shield in the Asia-Pacific.
					 Frank Rose, U.S. assistant secretary of State for Disarmament, said at the U.S. Federation of Scientists on Feb. 20 that the U.S. missile shield is aimed to defend the U.S. mainland from inter-continental ballistic missile attacks of north Korea and Iran, not to deter China and Russia. Now the U.S. has neither capability nor intention to intercept huge modern missiles of China and Russia, he added.
					
					 High-ranking officials of the U.S. are vying with each other in blustering as regards the deployment of THAAD in south Korea that it would not affect the strategic stability of China and Russia because it is a defensive one targeting medium- and short-range ballistic missiles of north Korea and, therefore, there is no need for China and Russia to react to the deployment in a oversensitive manner.
					
					 Vincent Stewart, director of the U.S. Defense Intelligence Agency, and the director of the operation department and the acting director of the intelligence department of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff in a joint written answer noted that north Korea's sustained development of nuclear weapons and missiles are posing a serious threat to the U.S. and its allies.
					
					 This fully revealed the baseness and shamelessness of the Obama administration as what they asserted is nothing but a smokescreen to sacrifice small countries while refraining from accusing big countries.
					
					 It is foolish, indeed, for the U.S. to calculate that it can divert elsewhere the international community's attention with such poor rhetoric though it is diverting the focus of its strategy in the new century to the Asia-Pacific and pushing forward the scenario for carrying out its new hegemonic strategy in real earnest.
					
					 The strategic position of the Asia-Pacific whose importance is increasing day by day is giving further momentum to the Obama administration's hegemonic ambition.
					
					 The U.S. is massively beefing up its forces in Northeast Asia and the Asia-Pacific to contain big powers in the region.
					
					 It decided to forward-deploy THAAD in its military base in south Korea while talking about "nuclear and missile threat" from the DPRK.
					
					 It is the U.S. ultimate goal to build missile shields at various levels in the regions around Russia and China and make missile attacks on them from all sides in contingency.
					
					 Secretary of State John Kerry, at a hearing on the State Department's budget for fiscal year 2016 of the International Relations Committee of the U.S. House of Representatives on Feb. 25, said it earmarked 1.4 billion U.S. dollars for executing the pivot to Asia policy of the present administration.
					
					 The U.S. is building the largest-ever military bases in the region since the Second World War as part of the scenario for implementing the Asia-Pacific policy.
					
					 For example, the project for expanding the U.S. military base is now under way in Phyongthaek of south Korea and the projects for expanding the bases for reinforcing and deploying U.S. Marines will be undertaken not only on Guam but in Iwakuni and Okinawa of Japan.
					
					 The U.S. announced that it would keep maximum readiness in the region, regardless of budget. It will keep 60 percent of the U.S. naval force in the region on a permanent basis, continue deploying more than 300 warships or 60 percent of the naval warships in the Pacific and additionally deploy four submarines on Guam. 
					
					 It is giving spurs to improving the performance of the existing bombers and nuclear missiles, bolstering up intelligence-gathering, monitoring and reconnaissance capabilities and developing and deploying high-performance laser guns, unmanned tactical vehicles and ultra-speed striking weapons. 
					
					 It is laughing stock of the world to claim that all those moves are to cope with "threat" from the DPRK.
					
					 Those countries in the Asia-Pacific region including big powers are strongly reacting to the U.S. moves to beef up its military muscle in the region, regarding them as a red light for strategic security.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korean Warmongers Start Large-scale Joint Military Exercises
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korean Warmongers Start Large-scale Joint Military Exercises
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers started Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises on Friday, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 Involved there were U.S. warships including Aegis destroyer which anchored at Mokpho Port, South Jolla Province on Feb. 25.
					
					 The Third Fleet of the puppet navy was keen on tactical mobile drill and joint naval shooting drill in the South Sea of Korea on the same day.
					
					 It was reported that a group of warships of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces will stage joint military exercises with the First and Second fleets of the puppet navy in the East and West Seas of Korea.
					
					 It is also planned to stage a naval interception operational drill and helicopter take-off and landing drill on an island in the South Sea of Korea on March 2.
					
					 In order to conceal the aggressive nature of Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises, the U.S. and south Korean warmongers claimed that they would start the exercises about one week later than last year with the possibility of the south-north dialogue into consideration. But they started the exercises much earlier than the plan, fully revealing their aggressive intention.
					
					 They can never evade the blame for driving the north-south relations to a catastrophe and entailing the unpredictable acute situation on the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: Hostile Moves against DPRK Denounced by S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
Hostile Moves against DPRK Denounced by S. Korean Organization
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea issued a statement on February 25 demanding a halt to the operation of scattering leaflets against the DPRK.
					 The statement condemned the riff-raffs of the Alliance for the Movement of Free North, who scattered the leaflets against the DPRK together with the "human rights foundation" of the U.S. in January, for seeking to continue scattering leaflets by using a drone.
					
					 It said that we cannot overlook the U.S. inciting and supporting such reckless act, noting that the leaflet scattering is a serious provocation that precipitates the war crisis on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Saying that bringing a war is the most cruel human rights abuse, it charged the U.S. has no right to talk about the human rights as it ignores the people's right to existence in a bid to accomplish its political aims.
					
					 The statement said that the reckless leaflet scattering operation should be stopped completely.

articles.title: Joint Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Feats Held in Italy
articles.content:
Joint Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Feats Held in Italy
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- A joint seminar on leader Kim Jong Il's feats took place in Milano, Italy on Feb. 14 on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					 Displayed in the venue of the seminar were photos showing feats of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display there were photos showing the struggle of the service personnel and people of the DPRK for building a thriving socialist nation and books on Songun Korea.
					
					 It was attended by personages of the Milano Center for the Study of the Juche Idea in Italy, the Italian Branch of the Korean Friendship Association and citizens.
					
					 The chief of the Milano Center for the Study of the Juche Idea praised Kim Jong Il as a great statesman who devoted all his life to the work for the happiness of his people, the prosperity of the country and the protection of socialism.
					
					 The secretary general of the Milano Center for the Study of the Juche Idea said that it is the greatest of the feats of Kim Jong Il that he defended the socialist cause and turned the DPRK into politically and ideologically strong nation and a military power which no formidable enemy dare attack.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Marked by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Marked by Foreign Media 
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Foreign media reported articles on the Day of the Shining Star, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, from Feb. 14 to 20.
					 The Zimbabwean paper Herald carried an article titled "Marshal Kim Jong Un is translating into reality the lifetime desire of HE Kim Jong Il" with a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il and a photo of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Reporting that the Day of the Shining Star is celebrated with splendor in the DPRK, the paper said:
					
					 The Korean people uphold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and eternal chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					
					 They are implementing the behests of Kim Jong Il to the letter in all sectors and units under the leadership of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The DPRK is sure to achieve a final victory in the anti-U.S. confrontation and construction of a thriving nation as it is led by Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The paper introduced the contents of a resolution of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, titled "On Greeting the 70th Anniversaries of the Founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Liberation of the Country as Revolutionary, Auspicious Events of Songun Korea Which Is Prospering under the Leadership of the Great Party."
					
					 A Syrian paper featured an article titled "On the 73rd anniversary of Kim Jong Il, leader of the DPRK, life devoted to future".
					
					 The article praised him for devoting his all to the prosperity of the country and happiness of the people.
					
					 The Egyptian TV Broadcasting Service carried a portrait of Kim Jong Un and broadcasted the Korean people celebrating the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Russian Papers Praise Kim Jong Il's Exploits
articles.content:
Russian Papers Praise Kim Jong Il's Exploits
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Russian papers carried special write-ups illustrated with a portrait of smiling leader Kim Jong Il and photos dealing with his revolutionary activities on Feb. 11 and 12 on his birth anniversary.
					 Selskaya Zhizn said in an article titled "Great nationalist" that he increased the military capabilities of the country in every way under the banner of Songun to avert a war on the Korean peninsula and defend the destiny of the Korean nation.
					
					 The paper went on:
					
					 He, even in the worst adversities, opened up a new era of building a thriving nation.
					
					 He made tremendous contributions to achieving the national reunification, the cherished desire of the Korean nation.
					
					 He was, indeed, a great nationalist who safeguarded the destiny of the country and nation and carved out a bright way.
					
					 Moskovskii Komsomolets carried a similar article.
					
					 Komsomolskaya Pravda in an article titled "Lifetime devoted to future" said that his life was characterized by his devotion to the rosy future of the country and people.
					
					 It was a goal and the greatest happiness of his life to dedicate himself to building a thriving nation and people's happiness.
					
					 He made his field guidance day and night.
					
					 His image will be kept in the hearts of not only the Korean people but the progressive mankind for his devotion to the rosy future of country and people.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Marked in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The Day of the Shining Star, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, was celebrated in Russia.
					 An opening ceremony of the Korean photo, book and handicrafts exhibition was held in Komsomolsk-na-Amure City, a meeting in Nidjegorod Region and lectures in Khabarovsk and Ulyanovsk cities from Feb. 10 to 13.
					
					 Displayed at the venue of the exhibition were photos documenting the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 On display there were their works, photos and books introducing the advantages and invincibility of Korean-style socialism and handicrafts showing the wisdom and talents of the Koreans.
					
					 The mayor of Komsomolsk-na-Amure City said Kim Jong Il's visit to the city will be recorded forever in the history of developing the Russia-DPRK friendship.
					
					 The chairman of the Nidjegorod Regional Branch of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea praised Kim Jong Il for turning the DPRK into a military power, upholding the banner of Songun.
					
					 The secretary of the Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation said the vitality of the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il has been given full play day by day.
					
					 The chairman of the "Jongilbong" Russia-Korea Friendship Association of Ulyanovsk Region said that Kim Jong Il was not only the great leader who wisely led the building of Korean-style socialism but the Songun brilliant commander who defended the sovereignty of the DPRK and destiny of the nation with his Songun politics.

articles.title: Foreigners Praise Kim Jong Il's Exploits
articles.content:
Foreigners Praise Kim Jong Il's Exploits
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Uganda, Pakistan, DR Congo and South Africa from Feb. 13 to 16 to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Speakers at the meeting in Uganda praised him for developing the DPRK into a satellite manufacturer and launcher and a nuclear weapons state by his original Songun politics. They stressed that he is alive in the hearts of progressive mankind for his tremendous contributions to the cause of global independence.
					
					 The secretary general of the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association said the Korean people boundlessly revered Kim Jong Il as he devoted himself to prosperity of the country and defence of global peace with his far-sighted wisdom and affection for the people.
					
					 The chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo said the life of Kim Jong Il was characterized by his devotion to the country and people and his perfect succession to the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The secretary of a regional committee of Gauteng Province of the South African Communist Party noted Kim Jong Il was a defender of socialism, adding that it was a great fortune and pride of the Korean people and a great honor of the progressive humankind to have him.
					
					 Congratulatory messages to Marshal Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings held in Pakistan and South Africa.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Celebrated by Personages of Russia, Dominica
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Celebrated by Personages of Russia, Dominica
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Personages of Russia and Dominica paid congratulatory visits to the DPRK embassies in their countries on Feb. 12 and 18 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The head and chief conductor of the Orchestra of the 21st Century of Russia and his party and singers of the State Academy Unaccompanied Chorus Named after Yurulov laid bouquets before a full-length painting of President Kim Il Sung standing together with Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 The general secretary of the United Left Movement of Dominica said that he visited the embassy to celebrate the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il together with Korean comrades, adding:
					
					 The United Left Movement of Dominica will as ever extend invariable solidarity to the just cause of the Korean people.
					
					 We fully support the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as it is the most fair and aboveboard proposal for achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea.
					
					 I wholeheartedly wish respected leader Kim Jong Un good health and hope he will continue wisely leading the Korean people in their struggle to reunify the country and build a thriving nation.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Nigeria
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- A Nigerian national preparatory committee for marking the 103rd birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was formed in Abuja on Feb. 23.
					 Ibrahim Mantu, member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria who is chairman of the Nigeria-DPRK Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 It decided to arrange colorful political and cultural events such as meeting and film show to praise the revolutionary career and feats of the President on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, his birth anniversary.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria de la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria de la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria
						
Pyongyang, 28 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio el pabellon de unidades vanguardias, acondicionado nuevamente en el Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					El Mariscal rindio homenaje al Presidente ante su estatua de pie en el hall central.
					
					Dijo que haya descrita muy bien por primera vez en nuestro pais la estatua de color de pie del Presidente respondiendo a las aclamaciones de los oficiales y soldados del EPC, y anadio que le parecia encontrarse directamente con el Presidente vivo con amplia sonrisa.
					
					Acto seguido, Kim Jong Un paso revista al pabellon de unidades vanguardias.
					
					El titulo de vanguardia definido el 19 de julio de 1950 en el periodo de la pasada guerra  coreana, fue el maximo premio y la maxima gloria, dispensados por el Presidente a fin de transmitir en la historia los meritos extraordinarios realizados por los soldados heroicos y hacer valerlos de generacion en generacion, subrayo.
					
					Recalco que el pabellon tiene gran importancia en transmitir eternamente la cronica revolucionaria de Songun de los grandes Generalisimos quienes hicieron glorificar de generacion en generacion las tradiciones de victoria de las unidades vanguardias.
					
					Apunto que la situacion de hoy, en visperas de la gran guerra de reunificacion de la patria, demanda con urgencia que todas las unidades del EPC sean vanguardias preparadas en lo ideo-politico, tecnico-militar y material para hacer frente a la guerra.
					
					Asevero que todas las unidades del EPC, al dinamizar el movimiento por alcanzar el titulo de unidad vanguardia, deben convertir en trapos las banderas de los imperialismos norteamericanos y sus fuerzas satelites en el combate a realizarse sin falta en el futuro contra el imperialismo yanqui.
					
					El mismo dia, el Mariscal recorrio tambien los pabellones de primera y segunda etapas de guerra.
					
					Senalo que es importante hacer bien la organizacion de visita y gestion del museo, base de la educacion en las tradiciones victoriosas del ejercito y pueblo de Corea y centro de la educacion antiyanqui.
					
					El Mariscal expuso la esperanza y conviccion de que los funcionarios y conferenciantes del museo cumpliran con su honrosa mision encargada ante si mismos.
					
					Le acompanaron Hwang Pyong So, Choe Ryong Hae, O Il Jong, Han Kwang Sang, Ri Jae Il, Ri Pyong Chol y Kim Yo Jong.

articles.title: Lampara de adorno - presente dedicado a Kim Il Sung por adeptos de Madagascar
articles.content:
Lampara de adorno - presente dedicado a Kim Il Sung por adeptos de Madagascar
Pyongyang, 28 de febrero (ACNC) -- En la Exposicion Permanente de Amistad Internacional de Corea esta exhibido el regalo obsequiado al Presidente Kim Il Sung por la delegacion de estudio de la idea Juche de Madagascar. 
					En abril del 74 (1985) de la Era Juche, antes de visitar a Corea para estudiar mejor la teoria del Juche, los miembros de la delegacion prepararon un regalo para el lider coreano.
					
					La lampara de adorno significa que la gran idea Juche ilumina la epoca de independencia del mundo, y demuestra al pueblo de Madagascar que vive de manera independiente forjando su destino por cuenta propia.
					
					El globo de la lampara fue hecho con una tela de color amarillo que existe solo en Madagascar.
					
					El presente es un testimonio de gran respeto de los adeptos a la idea Juche hacia el Generalisimo.

articles.title: Programados importantes juegos internacionales de futbol en 2015
articles.content:
Programados importantes juegos internacionales de futbol en 2015
						
Pyongyang, 28 de febrero (ACNC) -- Los equipos futbolisticos de ambos sexos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea participaran este ano en varios torneos internacionales.
					La seleccion nacional masculina tendra desde junio las clasificatorias de la region asiatica para obtener boleto a la Copa Mundial 2018.
					
					El equipo olimpico masculino jugara en marzo con los onces tailandes, camboyano y filipino como parte de las clasificatorias del Campeonato Sub-23 de la Confederacion Asiatica de Futbol (CAF) 2016.
					
					El equipo de juniores, que ocupo primer lugar en el Campeonato Sub-16 de la CAF 2014, asistira a la Copa Mundial Sub-17 (de octubre a noviembre) y el equipo juvenil competira con sus rivales brasileno y hungaro en la llave E de las clasificatorias por grupos de la Copa Mundial Sub-20 (de mayo a junio).
					
					En agosto, los equipos de ambos sexos participaran en la Copa de Asia Oriental. En la edicion 2013 del mismo evento, la seleccion nacional femenina habia ocupado el primer lugar.
					
					Los equipos femeninos sub-19, 16 y 14 tomaran parte en los campeonatos que seran auspiciados por la CAF en este ano.
